block.p: South Korea's largest carmaker, the Hyundai Motor Company, said its first-quarter pretax profit totaled 16 billion won ($14.4 million), supported by increased sales at home and abroad. First-quarter revenue was up 71 percent, to 4.28 trillion won ($3.86 billion), from a year earlier. The results are the best quarterly profit ever for the company. Hyundai Motor said it sold 364,672 vehicles in the first three months of this year, up 53 percent from a year earlier.
